body: That's an interesting point. I know that default scopes are applied well before Active Admin starts it's sorting code, however maybe there's an Active Record method to prepend a sort order.
The code in Active Admin that calls order on the Active Record collection is found at https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/blob/master/lib/active_admin/resource_controller/collection.rb#L47
Might be able to use with_exclusive_scope in the sort_order, although that may effect filters ...
Just found Active Record has a "reorder" option which may be of use here

Here's how I would approach it: don't use default scopes for sort order. And for the admin section, make it possible to specify a preferred sort order right in the active_admin DSL file. That should be pretty easy to implement.

It doesn't solve the case where the default_scope's sort order is set anyway. However IMHO, default_scope should be used only for critical stuff, like "don't display unpublished posts".

If you use it to sort, you're going to have to override it explicitly any time you need a different sort order. And doing that doesn't simply entail tacking on another order() clause to override it. It means, as tobyhede pointed out, that you have to start from scratch with `with_exclusive_scope` and then re-apply the critical parts of the default_scope if there's any. Which is annoying and error-prone.

Just my 2Â¢ :-)
+1 for a preferred sort order defined in the active_admin DSL file.

np, neither did I, I had to take a look on the implementation.

I was able to override the default and let my scopes take over by setting:

```
 config.sort_order = ''
```

We can fix this by calling 're_order' instead of order.

"The reorder method overrides the default scope order." - http://guides.rubyonrails.org/active_record_querying.html#reorder

I generally just call 'unscoped' - http://guides.rubyonrails.org/active_record_querying.html#removing-all-scoping

You can use active admins scope_to method to achieve this

```
ActiveAdmin.register Model do
  scope_to(:association_method => :unscoped) { Model }
  ...
  ...
end
```

This will remove any 'default_scope' declarations when active admin builds the collection
Not very verbose I know, but it works!

Alternately you could add a collection block to your active admin register block and override inherited resources begin_of_association_chain method to use Model.unscoped.

@bigfive Well, this would not work with models where the default scope contains conditions:

``` ruby
class User
  default_scope :order => :title, :active => true
end
```

I will use `reorder` then.
